Sequence Information.Source: sequence reversal, sequence shuffling, designed, man-made sequences

Literature.Author: Mechesso AF, Zhang W, Su Y, Xie J, Wang G. 2024
Literature.Title: Segment-Based Peptide Design Reveals the Importance of N-Terminal High Cationicity for Antimicrobial Activity Against Gram-Negative Pathogens.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (60%) toLL-10+R: 30%, W: 20%. GRAVY: -1.19, mol Wt: 1460.749; mol formula: C70H108N22O12; mol ex coeff: 11100.Activity: active against  S. aureus USA300 MRSA (MIC 32 uM), S.epidermidis 1457 (MIC 128 uM), P. aeruginosa E411-17 (MIC 16 ug/ml), E. coli E423-17 (MIC 32 uM), and A. baumannii B28-16 (MIC 64 uM).
